  • Method Details

    • authLogin

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/auth/login", produces="application/json", consumes="application/json") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseLogin> authLogin(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid RequestLogin requestLogin)
      POST /auth/login : Let's the user login to the system with given credentials.
      Parameters:
      requestLogin - (required)
      Returns:
      Login successful. (status code 200) or Found. User is already authenticated and redirected. (status code 302) or Bad request. The input is invalid or missing required fields. (status code 400) or Unauthorized. Invalid credentials provided. (status code 401) or Forbidden. Access to the resource is denied. (status code 403) or Too many requests. Rate limit exceeded. (status code 429)

    • authRegister

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/auth/register", produces="application/json", consumes="application/json") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> authRegister(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid RequestRegister requestRegister)
      POST /auth/register : Registers a new user into the system.
      Parameters:
      requestRegister - (required)
      Returns:
      Registration successful. (status code 201) or Found. User is already authenticated and redirected. (status code 302) or Bad request. The input is invalid or missing required fields. (status code 400) or Conflict. A user with the provided details already exists. (status code 409)

    • authRevalidate

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/auth/revalidate", produces="application/json", consumes="application/json") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseAuthRevalidate> authRevalidate(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid RequestAuthRevalidate requestAuthRevalidate)
      POST /auth/revalidate : Revalidates an authentication token. This endpoint is used to revalidate the authentication token given the refresh token of the user. This endpoint returns a new valid authentication token. Without refresh token, this endpoint will not create a new authentication token. For getting an authentication token without refresh token, try logging in instead.
      Parameters:
      requestAuthRevalidate - (required)
      Returns:
      Token refreshed successfully. (status code 200) or The refresh token is missing or invalid. (status code 400) or The provided refresh token is expired or revoked. (status code 401) or The request is not authorized (e.g., due to account restrictions). (status code 403)

    • twoFactorAuth

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/auth/two-factor-auth", produces="application/json", consumes="application/json") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseLogin> twoFactorAuth(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid RequestTwofactorAuth requestTwofactorAuth)
      POST /auth/two-factor-auth : Endpoint to validate OTP for two factor authentication. This is to validate the OTP generated if two factor authentication is enabled. The login ID must be tagged along with the OTP to map which login attempt this OTP belongs to.
      Parameters:
      requestTwofactorAuth - (required)
      Returns:
      OTP is valid for the given login ID. Hence user is authenticated and both access and refresh tokens are granted. (status code 200) or Bad request. Either OTP or login ID or both are missing. (status code 400) or Unauthorized. The OTP does not match with the one generated for this login ID or invalid OTP is provided. (status code 401)
